review: My visit to Red Robin yesterday, after taking in a matinee at the Cinemark 24 theater, was as good as I could have hoped for. It had been a couple years since I'd been a patron at this franchise of burger-themed restaurants, and it was my first time at the Albuquerque location since childhood. With age, I've come to appreciate the efforts that Red Robin makes to accommodate families, couples, drinkers, and the young. There seems to be something for everyone here. I ordered a bottle of Miller Lite ($3.50) and, guided by my heart, opted for the A1 Peppercorn Burger (as lampooned in season 15 of South Park). The food arrived quickly, but after a few bites, it was clear that the meat wasn't medium-rare, but rather, well done. Weighing my options, I decided to seek satisfaction and notified my waitress that the burger wasn't prepared how I'd ordered it. She sent it back to the kitchen, and a replacement was brought out swiftly. The second time was the charm. Reasonably pink inside, I accepted this sandwich and savored every bite. My waitress was quick to keep the steak fries coming, and I certainly ate my fill. At some point, it's necessary to cut the cord before too much gluttony transpires. Overall, I was satisfied by the food, and I appreciated the kitchen staff's willingness to remake my hamburger. Though the addition of tablets to every booth and table brings Red Robin in line with Applebee's and Chili's for chilling post-millennial digital invasiveness, I understand how these devices can generate revenue and simplify certain ordering practices. At the end of the day, I still prefer old-fashioned human interaction, and this I received in abundance from the waitress. Perhaps on another special occasion I'll venture back to this eatery; meanwhile, I have happy memories to tide me over.

Firstly, the one star review had nothing to do with the server, Eric, because he was awesome. Sadly, a server can only do so much and all they do is place the order and deliver it anyway. My order was a ghost pepper burger but received a reg burger with BBQ sauce and jalapeño slices but no ghost pepper sauce and no jalapeño coins (fried and breaded). The cook argued with the waiter that it wasn't bbq sauce but there is a huge difference and this wasn't my first ghost pepper burger... this is the same burger I get every time I go to any Red Robin... and this was not it. When the waiter returned, I noticed all the cook did was shove 6 small jalapeño coins under the bun, crinkling the bun and not making the burger any better and the cook didn't add the ghost pepper sauce either.  I wasn't going to send it back again because I didn't want to eat spit or something else... I simply did without a burger because this one was horrible. Second thing that didn't help was the fact that we ordered Garlic Parmesan fries and they sent sweet potatoe fries instead... when the waiter brought my replacement fries... they were plain... not garlic Parmesan.   The waiter offered to take the burger off my bill but didn't see that taken off. We were running late so I just paid and decided to leave this review instead. By far the worst experience I've ever had at a Red Robin (And I've been to Red Robin's across the country. I'll never return to this location.

I really like the option of curbside to go I used it for the first time today and it was very easy and quick. I was a little disappointed that I bought the Avo-Cabo salad and it's a much smaller portion then it used to be. Also there were only three little slices of avocado in the salad. Considering the price is $10.99 and the name suggest there's gonna be a lot of avocado I was a bit disappointed. Otherwise the salad & the tea tasted good so that's a plus. Come on Red Robin don't be so cheap with the avocado next time.
I've been to this RR many times over the years, usually for lunch before catching a movie at the theater across the street. The food and service are usually good. Good for kids and groups.

Red Robin's! Yummmmmm... You can always count on Red Robin Gourmet Burger to satisfy that huge hunger feeling. I ordered the Advo-Cobb Salad which was extremely fresh, delicious and HUGE and my partner ordered the fish and chips which is my 2nd favorite item on the menu. Neither one of us finished our dinner, which meant we had left-overs for lunch the next day. We also had the Pickle Nickles for an appetiizer and the Pickle Nickle sauce is the bomb! Our server Ashley was perfect, checking in on us constantly, but not too frequently, to make sure we were well taken care of. Red Robin's is a fun place to take the family with large and small appetites, and everybody leaves happy and satisfied! We had had a very busy day and needed a good filling meal. You can always count on Red Robin's!

Great food and amazing service. My husband and I always sit at the bar. Zach is our favorite. He's attentive and always gives us five-star service.  We recently went to the new Uptown location, and I was disappointed with the service there. Although that location is closer than the Office location, we will drive further just to have Zach wait on us. He's the best!  I hope management realizes what a rockstar bartender they have.
I love the food here. The service is always bad, except every 8th time. The dining area is always dirty and today they put us in a booth that snagged my leggings.

I've enjoyed burgers here before, but am super psyched about the patty in a lettuce wrap option. I tried the Whiskey River BBQ Burger with lettuce to replace a bun. Yum. The burger was served hot and the produce was fresh.  It was great. My hubby had a mushroom and Swiss burger...he said it was very good.  Service was great. Drinks were refilled quickly. In fact, each table had a call button for guests wishing to call the server over.  My hubby and I agree that this spot is consistently good.

Let me preface with, if given the chance, I'll always go to an independently, locally owned Mom & Pop joint before I'll go to a large chain restaurant like this one. However, every now and again you find yourself in one out of necessity or geography. We were actually headed out on a Friday night to a different restaurant, however, things happened.   So, Friday night, it's just Red Robin, what gives? What on Earth is going on? Is there a convention in town or something? My goodness, 30 minutes later and we finally get seated. Our waitress, though, very efficient! Nice, well knowledgeable about their menu and Johnny (or Jenny) on the spot with service!  The food? Reliable! That is the upside, in my opinion, of a chain restaurant like this, or Applebee's, or go on down the list, they're generally consistent, which is a good thing. The pretzel bites? Amazing!!!! The burgers? Once again, very reliable! We were all pretty satisfied with our meal, and guess what... they have beer milkshakes! I know, right? How crazy is that? Actual milkshakes with beer as a main ingredient. I doubt you'll get looped on them, after all, you'd probably suffer from brain freeze prior to getting looped, but pretty cool anyway. Like most of you, we'll return from time to time, how can you go wrong?

Would have been 5 stars if the waitress Jolene didn't argue with my mother and I about where we could sit in the bar. We asked the bartender and 3 hostesses if it was okay to sit in a booth and she would NOT let us. Luckily we got a table where we didn't receive her terrible service. We got burgers and beers and it was still worth it. I just wish we know why this waitress was being so uptight about where we could sit... I guess she wanted us to sit in the back of the... restaurant. I recommend just sitting in the normal restaurant. Avoid the waitresses who are rude at the begin and enjoy the beers :)

I'm being generous with two stars.  They had the Stanley cup game on.  The servers and kitchen had issues today.  I didn't get the drinks I ordered.  We ordered chips and salsa.  We got about 10 oily strips of chips and one ounce of half frozen salsa.  We waited 30 minutes for the food to come out.  My salmon tasted like cardboard; about 15 minutes over cooked. My fish arrived with just the dry salmon.  No broccoli or coleslaw.  Our server then gave another patron a shower with a cup of water.  The couple next to us complained about their food too.  The manager didn't do anything to minimize the horrible experience.  I would go back to Red Robin but not this location.

Servers are great, I would give them five stars if I could. They were busy as all get out , so i don't blame them for the slow check. There were two of them running an area meant for 4 servers, maybe 5. Someone had called in sick, one guy showed up and was angry because he was immediately being given two tables with larger parties. The two servers there hadn't made it to take their orders yet.. The manager need to hire more or manage time better. Maybe help out when it's busy as it was.  I could have left, if the manager/supervisors would keep their ziosks in working order. It was pitiful to sit here so long, it was my birthday and I couldn't go to the movie I wanted to because I missed the time waiting to pay.

This place has had its shares of ups and downs mostly due to the frequent management changes. But the corporate decisions certainly do not help trying to cut corners wherever and however they can, always at the customers' expense. Their "cups" of soup now at the same price of $3.99 are served in a dish so small its the equivalent of an olive dish. Their side salads at $4.99 are now served in a small bread dish. Ridiculous! If RR wants to earn a better reputation, they should start by not trying to cheat their customers.

This is from an experience about two weeks. I think it needs to be posted. I had the macaroni plate, new item I suppose. It was good until I noticed it was cold in the middle and not all of the cheese was melted. The top part was crunchy, and I liked that, but it was probably from a heat lamp that didn't get it up to temp. Needless to say, I was popping rolaids and seltzer water with sprite like there was no tomorrow the following week after. It's crucial to make sure food is up to the correct temperature. If you allow the heat lamp to do YOUR WORK, you could get someone sick, and I did. Dairy products have to be up to the correct temperature.

Every time, we come here, they screw up our order 75% of the time. They screw up with my husband's burger, so when they came with the new one. They charged us for both. The manager took off the one off our bill. On the milkshakes, the classic, is way less then an average one.. Stop being unfair with the amount & give out more for $4.95. What's with the hospitality?! The server was nice until, I ask for a medium free style burger to add  Blue Cheese & grilled onions on it. She corrected me on the menu. But after ordering, she was nice again.. Absurd. I am tired of the bad attitude/ tough of people. No need. What we have to go by the menu, if not I'm messing up your work.really ?!  They need to be a waitress & be nice & have patiences. We as Customers gives you business & trips. So think twice about having an attitude. No return to this location.  I was a hostess, waitress & Bartender. I had Customers substitute a lot of things.  It's your part to write down,what the Customers want before the kitchen. So the kitchen can make what we want. Get over it. I'm not the only one that wants something different. Do your job, Nics ( I think, that I spelled her name correctly.)

For a chain burger joint it is fine, but I have to say, if you could manage to serve my husband a warm meal, we would probably still frequent as often as we used to.  My daughter loved your kids spaghetti meal and the fact it was all she could eat. I have always gotten the bacon guacamole burger and enjoy it. The tower of onion rings were always a hit, but no matter what my husband ordered, he was always disappointed in a luke-warm meal.  I guess I have to say, we have moved on to find something more satisfying.

Burger is good the bottomless fries are a joke. What you get is maybe 8 fries. Server has a bad attitude. Asked for mustard lady says to ask my server. Soup was not hot. Disappointed in the red robin.

This red robin is very consistently good!  I ordered a burger a special way. It was perfect.  Eric ordered fish n chips, very good! Fries are always great...try them with garlic and herbs.  Ranch dressing is very tasty.

Wow! Nicely done! Now that Red Robin has added "and Brews" to it's name, they have also upgraded the décor of the restaurant. It is now very well appointed (for a Red Robin) and more adult. They've also added on table electronic ordering where you can order everything from your first beer to desert without having to "wait" on the waiter. You can also pay your bill through this handy little gadget as well as play games (for a couple of extra bucks). The burgers and fries were good, as always, no surprise there. Just very happy that they've changed the décor to something a bit more upscale.
Thanks to Zach at the  Red Robin for making our Causal Valentine's Day dinner st the bar . He was amazing to watch him serve with a great attitude and speed. Burger, beer and mud pie.

Came here on a Saturday night with two friends. I got the teriyaki chicken sandwich, one friend got a cheeseburger, and the other got a salad with chopped chicken. Salad Friend's salad was swimming in dressing, too much dressing. Cheeseburger friend and I enjoyed our sandwiches. Even after our sandwiches and bottomless fries and broccoli, we still had enough room for dessert and split the chocolate fruffles (chocolate sticks with berry sauce on the side). The service was super-slow, so slow that Salad Friend wanted to talk to a manager. I'm a little more forgiving-- it was a Saturday night and the place was about 2/3 full, but I still do think the service was slow.

As a gluten-free diner, I am mildly obsessed with the lettuce-wrapped burgers at Red Robin.  I usually opt for the Tavern Double with added pickles and a side of campfire sauce for my fries.  The guacamole bacon burger is another good option.  Service has been hit or miss, and it's typically better in the restaurant than in the bar area.  My favorite server left Albuquerque around the same time I did, and I missed him on my most recent visit. (Tony, if you're out there, it's not the same without you!)  You can't beat the unlimited fries, but if you're on a health kick, you can get unlimited broccoli instead. Yay?

This was a great choice for our evening before the concert we were going to.  The place was clean, the service was quick and knowledgeable, the food was good, and the prices reasonable.   I always judge a place that serves burgers by their beer selection and while they left a little to be desired they had what I wanted.  I would definitely come back.

Wife and I had their fish & chips for lunch with only lemonade & coleslaw.  Plenty of fish (Cod, 4 good sized pieces each).  Food was good but not worth a $45 check.  Tennis on all TV's.  This is an uptown hamburger joint?  Pretty expensive lunch!  Won't be lunching there again.  Or even dinner.

I love the bottomless fries! Quick food! Great costumer service! This location always gets us seated quickly, and we have a 4 month old baby and she's always content in this location and they always accommodate our request for the bigger individual booths. Highly recommended!!! (:

We came to Albuquerque on a trip, we were very excited to see that there was a Red Robin in town so we came. I love their freckled lemonade and burgers but was very disappointed when we got what we ordered.  The lemonade was water with some strawberries in it, it tasted awful my husband also got a drink that was watered down.  When I told the waiter,  all she did was put more lemonade in it which didn't make it any better, they never offered another one, so I didn't even drink it.  When we finally got our order it was completely cold.  The fries were cold and hard and the burgers were cold. The manager never came over to apologize or anything. Definitely the worst Red Robin we've been to.

We come here every so often and usually enjoy it, today was not one of those times, so unfortunately 2 stars today. Chips, salsa and guacamole were just ok, I wouldn't order them again, but was hungry so we ate them. Shared twonthings, one of them being The fiery ghost tavern burger, on the menu says "this combo of ghost pepper sauce, pepper jack cheese and fried and fresh jalapeños will have you seeing double." The server told us the pic was deceiving.  That it is actually two kid patties, not two regular patties, we were fine with that and thankful she told us.  When we ordered it at a medium cook, she said we couldn't,  because they were small they had to come medium well...no bueno. However for just $2 more we could get a single large pattie and get it cooked to our liking. That resulted in about a 6 Oz pattie cooked well, awesome. There were only two fried jalapeños in the whole burger, but we're soggy from some sort of sauce slathered on both the top and bottom bun, I didn't wanna know what it was.  I would never order that burger again, and the size of the pattie was in no way worth the regular price of the burger, much less the $2 up charge.  We got a prime rib dip was was pretty good.  I understand that sourdough bread can get hard, but half of it was unedible.  I just had dental work done, no way was I gonna even attempt to chew that thing, but we ate most of the meat. K got mac n cheese, kraft if always reliable. The fries, well, we're HORRIBLE! And I remember really liking them. So I ordered a fresh side of fries which was brought to us still hot.  And those were delicious...for about 2 minutes.  They then we're hard and cold.   The 2 stars come from the expo window. ..and our burger and fries.  The expo window can be seen from most of the restaurant.  The kitchen was throwing out plates of food and they pretty much just sat in the window for minutes on end. I counted 11 minutes on a group of burgers cuz we had nothing else to do but wait for our server. Pretty sure reviews would be better if food got out hot, I'm sure we'll give it another chance, but not anytime soon.
Food was mediocre. Service awful. Actually what service? Our waitress did not check on us once during the whole meal until we were finished.  We never got a drink refill. Really disappointing.

It seems like I always visit at the busiest times - every corner is crowded and the servers are running like crazy. The food is pretty decent and the bottomless fries are always popular. My favorite are the flavored teas, the bottlecap jalapenos and the chicken sandwich. Although the burgers are good, they are super messy and tend to fall apart. We've been here several times and the last time our server just disappeared, good thing we were able to pay via the little tabletop checkout. We still wonder what happened to her.
Been here many times, must say this was a disappointment.  Just all around a mediocre visit.  Server,  was blah, food was blah,  not a great time.

Nice laid back atmosphere. Good food! Clean bathrooms. Service was satisfactory initially, but significantly improved after we got our food. I was a little disappointed because they ran out of strawberries for their freckled lemonade, which I usually look forward to getting when I go there.

Food was great. Bree was our server and she was very good. The only negative was a couple brought a large dog inside. If it had been wearing a service vest that is understandable. Thankfully the manager had them move out to the patio.
This Red Robin has been renovated to the chain's new style. It's extremely popular during prime lunch and dinner times, be ready to wait a few minutes. Don't forget the unlimited fries!

OK, so this Red Robin is sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo much better than the other Red Robin in ABQ (the other one is located in the NW by the Cottonwood Mall).  The menu selection is stellar in comparison to the other location.  The food was good, juicy, delicious. The waiter was attentive and was on-the-ball.  I know, I mentioned it already, but I need to elaborate further.  The menu selection is extensive, with lots of appetizers including their classic onion rings also chili chili con queso which was scrumptious and their pretzel bites. I strongly suggest these.   Their burgers are yummy and in typical Red Robin-fashion.  They have extra items on the menu for entrees.  So, I strongly suggest coming in and giving it a whirl.  You won't regret it!!!

9 bucks for a quarter pound  burger...i think not...Cold frigging french fries...no thank you. The fries you jerks served me tonight were cooked around noon and I stopped by at 5pm for my carryout. What a bummer. This place used to provide good sized burgers and bottomless fries. It evident the fries were from the bottom alright...cold...soggy...and from the bottom of the trash without any decent flavor or crunch at all...not a location I will ever visit again.

My wife and I have enjoyed Red Robin in the past but our experience last night was by far the worst ever! !!!  It started with a rather long wait to be seated,  after taking a peak in the dining area the place was nearly empty so I couldn't figure out why we had been waiting over 45 minutes for.  I spoke to the host and his response was that his manager would not allow him to sit us because they were short on servers so we had to wait,  well that should have been a clue to leave but we continued to wait.   So we finally sat down after nearly an hour wait and we waited another 20 min to have our drink order taken and 40 min for our food order to be taken.   Our server brought our food out to us and it was cold,  the fries that were served to us must have been cooked when they first opened for the day cause they were cold as ice and hard as a rock.   If I could give no stars I would.   This place has gone down hill bad and should be avoided! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Food was amazing despite waiting for a while. A different server brought the food to us. Service was awful. Our waitress did not check on us once during the whole meal until we were finished. She kepton passing us. No drink refills. My boyfriends beer took 10 mins to get to the table. No "bottomless" fries either. I am usually always satisfied when I come here but not this time around.

We used to love Red Robins but tonight was terrible. The waitress was slow and very inattentive. We ordered an appetizer that we never got. Took a while to get our food, no cutlery or napkins then she never checked on us once during our meal. But was quick to help her friends sitting nearby. For he price I'd expect some good customer service. Disappointing.

I ordered the royal robin and it was amazing perfectly cooked...they even put the items on the side as I requested... The service was spot on...I didn't have to ask for anything...I drink a lot of water...ask for Valerie she was our server

Great food. Burgers that'll fill you up with the first bite! I love their bottomless fries. Severs are always eager to help and really friendly. They're flexible with the menu. Food cooked to perfection. Everything is great but the wait time is a bit long but trust me is well worth the wait.

The wait staff was slow and uncaring. I was asked how I wanted my burger. I asked for a rare burger but received a well done burger. When I asked my server about it, she responded with "we can only cook the burgers a certain way. We can't do rare." This was after waiting 25 minutes for the burger. I still don't understand why they ask how you want your burger cooked if you really don't have a choice. I used to love this place but no longer. I don't see myself returning.

Fabulous burgers with plenty of varieties to chose from. Bottomless fries comes in handy when you have family members with big appetites. I don't recommend ordering mixed drinks though. I ordered the Spiked Sweet Tea. It was bitter & not even made correctly. It was supposed to be tea flavored Vodka & lemonade but it didn't have any lemonade in it. I sent it back to be remade. It came back looking & tasting more like it should but it still doesn't come even remotely close to the delicious spiked sweet tea at Cheddar's.
Never had bad service or a bad burger here.  Nice remodel, and great new menu!!

The unlimited fries are a really good perk about this place. I love the fact that you can switch out what kind of fries you have too. The burger was cooked pretty well. Service was pretty good. Overall I would say pretty good.

Great burgers and superb customer service! I had the Black and Blue burger. It was full of mushroom flavor which I love. The non gourmet burgers are good but a bit overpriced. They could improve the burger buns. Other than that, they are flavorful and tasty. I almost forget fries are refilled for free.

Food was excellent. Service was a little slow when it comes to drinks. bartenders seem very laxed and in no hurry. Otherwise it was a great relaxing time out with friends. Also conveniently located near the theater.

Did not even make it to a table! We arrived around 6pm on a Friday afternoon. My daughter is getting a headache and needs to eat soon so I jump out of the car while my wife is parking to save time. The hostess checks us in a gives a 25 minute wait. That seems reasonable. We wait inside for the 25 minutes as multiple tables are called.  I go up to the hostess and ask her how much longer the wait might be. Her answer: "Oh about another 20 - 25 minutes." I explain to her that we have already been waiting that long and her response is to just look at me blankly. Meanwhile my daughter's headache is well on its way. Thankfully we left and hurried over to the Fox and Hound where we were seated immediately. What a joke.

Oh man I love this place so hard. We usually don't go to red robin, but we picked this one because we were new in town and don't know where else to go (sorry!). I'm SO glad we did.  This place has great service! They gave our son some fries to keep him busy before our food got there, my husbands drink was always full (mind you this guy drinks 4-5 diet cokes in one siting), they make awesome shakes, and they gave our 2 year old a balloon when we left! This is our new to go spot in Albuquerque.

When did Red Robin get to be so expensive?   I ate here because it was close to my hotel - very convenient.  The burger I had was fine (bacon cheeseburger) - not great, just OK. But $10.50?   Really?  And that wasn't even the most expensive one on the menu!  There's plenty of really great burger places everywhere that are less expensive and are far superior. Ok place to eat for convenience, otherwise go down the street.
The food tasted grwat.the service was fast and friendly.whta Moe could you want. We did find out that it is no longer a franchise   is back  With corporate. So will have to see how it goes.
Loved this location. The menu and signs are all very creative. Excellent marketing team behind red Robin. The food was so good and our service was amazing. All around a great dining experience

They've added new Angus burgers on chibota to menu. Nice going !! My daughter had hers well while I ordered mine medium.  Medium is the way to go!!! Accompanied with a tall beer,  yummy!!. It was the bomb!!! The joint is kinda pricey for burgers but heh why not splurge on a gourmet burger once in a while.

Heck yes I love this place. Great food, friendly service and attentive managers! Everyone looked like they were having fun on their shift and the fun vibe floated to our table as well. I would come in everyday if fries were healthy :) you are missing out if you haven't tried red robins royal burger.
Red Robin use to be good as a kid and then I went a few weeks ago and the menu sucks and you have yo use the stupid computer thing to pay

I don't like to eat burgers too often but when I do, red robin always satisfies me. I usually get the red royal burger. It has bacon & egg in there. Dip it in ranch & yummo. I'm nit picky when it comes to ranch. Yes I'm a weirdo like that. But I love their ranch sprinkled with a little of their bottled red robin seasoning. As if I need to add any more salt right?  The shakes are usually good, except for the salted caramel...too much salt in that one. The kiddos are always happy with what ever they order from the kids menu too. And they have enough tv's around to keep the kiddos busy. Service is always fast & awesome no matter how packed it is. Place & bathrooms are always clean too.

Red Robin.....awsome burgers me my cousin Paul & Ruby Tamami Skip always great to be with all 4 of you funny family clowns.....staff was awsome no wait  we were seated quick food was perfect you can never go wrong with Red Robin Burgers n Fries #1 be back soon

I wish I didn't have to even give a star. We went in with a larger group (9 + a high chair) on a Saturday night. When we arrived there was only one group of 4 in front of us. We were told it would be a 30 minute wait. After about 40 minutes and seeing people getting sat in front of us, including tables of 6. We approached the hostess stand where we were simply told "I'm not sure how much longer." 55 minutes goes by and we see 3 groups that came in after us leave before we even got sat! We again approached the hostess stand after an hour, double the time we were told to wait, and let them know we have seen multiple tables that arrived after us leave and we haven't been sat! Their response, "yea I know" at this point we were livid! We called another restaurant to see what their wait was while we went to speak to a manager. The manager was just as useless as the hostess staff.  He had no empathy towards our situation. We decided we were leaving and at that point he was trying to get us to stay. The manager we dealt with was Joe and he was not an individual that I would make a manager. I have been in customer service all my life and I am a manager for a hotel in the area. I know and understand how to empathize and apologize to a guest when they are upset. Joe did neither of those. I will not recommend this location to any of the guests that stay at my hotel and hope that this post does some good and gets the staff retrained so they know how to work with their guests.

The best gourmet burgers around. Love the bottomless sweet potato fries. They do an incredible lettuce wrap for the burger and cater very well to my gluten free needs. Topped it all off with a monster sea salt Carmel milkshake. And the kids all got bottomless root beer floats. Great place to take the family.

Yup, I'm a fan of Red Robin -- I typically have the same experience no matter which RR I visit.  This time it was a group of 6 of us. We were able to get sat right away, which was extra nice.  I switched it up and had some chicken wings this time. Teriyaki, extra crispy to be specific. They were pretty darn tasty! One of my colleagues said that the "best" RR burger is the Royal Robin burger w/ the egg... however, I beg to differ - -I love their Whiskey River burger. Yummmmm.  Great place to catch a bite before watching a movie across the street.  Oh, and bonus for last night's visit - - I didn't hear any annoying RR Happy Birthday singing. yay! :)

1 star. I hope this changes your mind about going there. First of the whole place is way too loud. Looks dirty, and just overwhelming. And time for a story.  Went there for my moms birthday sat on the patio and first problem that came up was the ground was full of a broken ketchup bottle all over had to hardly set my feet down to not get them nasty and dirty. When they brought us appetizer plates, my moms was not clean. It was quite dirty. My mom told him this plate isn't clean bring me a new one. So he argued that it was and then walked into the building (still in sight of us) and whipped it off with his shirt. Came out and tried to give it to her my mom called him out on it and said we watched you this isn't clean this is still dirty. Finally he brought  us a clean dish. It was a horrible experience. The best part of the meal was leaving.

Red Robin recently refurbished this location and the changes are much more than cosmetic. They are obviously going for a more upscale look and it looked great but the service, which was once excellent was very bad. We saw our server maybe twice. It took him 20 minutes to get us our drinks (water!) I looked over and saw him take them off another empty table that he had placed them on to go get another customer the sugar packet bowl and must have forgotten! Also a dirty table next to us sat empty and un-bussed for almost the entire time we were there. There were a lot of people, but certainly wouldn't call the place crowded. The food was of the same quality but when the service is so poor, the desire to spend your money there is low. Please Red Robin, bring back your excellent customer service.

Well, I really don't like to give bad reviews but here goes. It started out well enough but I knew something was wrong when the waiter had 4 tables and he was having issues keeping track of his area. Granted I've never been a waiter and I'm not judging him but I saw other waiters that seem to have more tables and they seemed to tend to customers effortlessly. So I chalked it up to he must have been new. He meant well but I could easily tell he was overwhelmed. I ordered their new Colossus Burger and I didn't include the picture but instead I included a picture of the "picture" because once I got it, it looked nothing like the picture which made me kind of upset. I think if you advertise something it should look like the picture. Instead I got the lazy mans version which was pretty frustrating. There was suppose to be "brisket" on the burger but it was nowhere in sight and if it was, it was buried under the mounds of onions. I'm not a big fan of onions so I took it off looking for the brisket and I found maybe one or two small pieces. The burger it self was just ok, I could have done better at home honestly. Get a charcoal grill, fresh patties and BAM, a better burger then I ate. As the waiter was running from table to table, refilling drinks, he spilled a lemonade all over my brother in law. All in all not a great experience. In defense of red robin, I've had better experiences in the past but today was not one of them.

I absolutely love this place! Not only is their food good, but more importantly the service is great! The employees are friendly and take good care of you.  Drinks are great too! Shout out to Eddie, Sierra, Zack, Josh and Kalani who go above and beyond for their customers.

This place has gone down hill since the last time I ate here. I visited this place on Sat. Feb. 6. Me and wife ordered some burgers. The buns on these burgers were falling apart when we started to eat them. We brought it to waitresses attention and she sent the manager to talk to us. The manager did nothing on this issue. He just said sometimes we get bad bread. We did not even finish the burgers because there was no bun left, it all fell off while eating. The manger said we can cook you another one and I did not want to wait it was busy and it would probably be the same. The manager seemed like he was really new and had no experience. If I were the manager I would not even charge the customer for the poor quality of the burgers.
The service was good, the food was tasty, but it's the only burger joint in town that doesn't offer green chili on their burgers.   I can't believe it....

Red Robin in general has really gone downhill lately and this place has become even worse since the remodel. The really sad truth right now is that even though Red Robin is known for their burgers, you can now get a much, much better burger (that's also cheaper) at Denny's! Don't get me wrong, when you get a decent server, the bottomless stake fries and bottomless root beer floats are cool, but the burgers are just plain pathetic. Also, the service at this place is horrible when they're busy. If you must have a weak overpriced burger, at least avoid the peak hours.

I love Red Robin it's so delicious. Helpful, kind and generous staff. Always have had good experiences eating here. The burgers are way better than Five Star's, the burgers are also huge and tasty for a good price. It's as good as it gets for me!

Great happy hour! Good selection of local and typical draft beers and good deals on other drinks too.  Attentive service.  Nice patio.  I appreciate how clean everything is - bathrooms, dining room, bar, patio.  We like to come after work for a drink and some jalapeño coins or sweet potato fries.  For lunch, give the Avo-Cobb-O salad a try - it's one of my favorite salads ever.

I love that I can eat GF and get a great meal without feeling like my options are super limited.  I was disappointed in the service though.  While it wasn't terrible we were starving and could not find a waitress to bring the kids a plate of fries while we waited for her to get to us so we could order.  The place was not that busy and never saw the manager once.

Very bad experience here. I've been to many Red Robin restaurants and this was the worst. I ordered a margarita and it was completely watered down--way too much ice. Then I had the ensalada chicken and it came out completely cold and raw. The waiter took it back and it was reheated, only to come out rubbery on the outside and raw on the inside. The manager came over to us afterward and comped our dinner, but this was just disgusting. Definitely avoid this place!
Our hamburgers were a bit cold, and lacked in flavor. Not worth the price that we paid.   The service however, was friendly and prompt.

I love the food here. I've never had anything wrong. The only problem I've noticed is the staff seem too worried about how they look, flirting, and messing around at times. It seems like their waitstaff is very forgetful and come back constantly to ask what we ordered. Today my waitress kept forgetting what we ordered, poured water into our sprite, when we asked for more fries she said "oh you're good?" then walked off, she was out of it. Onto the positive stuff! Their burgers are always on point. They have new dipping sauces. The roasted green chile aioli is tasty. I love bottomless fries and drinks!

I love Red Robin. Loved it in Orange County and loved it in Las Vegas. When I moved to ABQ, I was happy to see that Red Robin was here as well - although there are only two locations and both are a distance from my house. At any rate, I had a craving so we trekked to this location.  Ah, the oh so wonderful BBQ Chicken Wrap, without the BBQ sauce (go figure) and the bottomless fries with ranch dressing. It was yummy and just what I wanted. Oh, did I mention the Diet Cherry Coke? It felt like home and reminded me of all the great times with great friends at the various Red Robins in CA.  I almost forgot to mention the cupcakes. Chocolate, vanilla and strawberry lemonade. I took home one of each so I could write a comprehensive review. The frosting on all three was creamy with the right amount of sweetness. The chocolate cake was a bit dry but there was chocolate in the middle. The vanilla cake was moist and also had cream in the middle. The strawberry lemonade - my favorite - was fantastic. Moist with strawberry cream in the middle and a great flavor. Unfortunately (or perhaps fortunately for my weight and wallet) we will not be visiting Red Robin often. It is simply too far from Downtown and there are too many other restaurants to visit. If I happen to make the journey to Cottonwood Mall, I may check out that Red Robin - as a public service to the other Yelpers who are hungry and in the vicinity.

Good food and professional service if you are eating there. I work close by and have tried to call in my order for pick up a couple of times, and they have gotten my order wrong every single time. Things from forgetting the dressing for a salad or completely missing parts of my order. So, moral of the story...great place if you're eating there, but do not call in your order...EVER...cuz they will mess it up!!

This is a great place to come with kids, especially on Wednesdays, when they have free face painting, a balloon man who cruises the tables with his uncanny ability to make whatever object you desire out of balloons, and the big red bird himself.  When my siblings come to visit with my nieces and nephews, there is no easier and friendlier place to take the brood.  Here they can yell and whine, get out of their chairs to wander the restaurant, and exhibit all other manner of inappropriate public behavior, and no one is disturbed! Everyone else is occupied with their own unruly crew, and the noise level is such that it would take a lot to pierce the din. Ahhh, Red Robin.  Normally I eschew corporate dining establishments.  In most chain restaurants, the food is shipped in frozen and premade, the environment is too brightly lit and artificial, and the service tends to be canned and delivered by generally indifferent teenagers. Red Robin certainly does not wander off this beaten path.  But what about that tower of golden onion rings, deep-fried to perfection, served with an ungodly good  barbeque-mayo concoction? That bottomless basket of steak fries? And the burgers? In full disclosure, I am a vegetarian.  And let me tell you, Red Robin serves a profoundly gratifying veggie burger.  I try to eat primarily healthy, whole foods, I really do.  But sometimes a person just wants a veggie patty smothered with onion straws, sautéed mushrooms and blue cheese.  Served on a soft, white bun with a side of fried stuff.  It's bad for you and delicious, and I've learned to stave off the self-loathing with gentle reminders that there are more important things in the world to worry about than the size of my ass. I give Red Robin 4 stars while judging it against its competitors, which in my mind are other chain restaurants and burger joints.  The kids are fed and entertained, which allows the fully grown among us time to relax and enjoy our under-poured, over-priced, artificially-colored cocktails while talking shit and reaching for (this time I mean it) that last fry.  God damn, it's good to be an American!

I have been eating at this Red Robin for years and havent had a bad experience yet.My food is always good and the bottomless fries are great.A little pricey,so ive cut out getting any drinks to save on the bill.Used to get the freckled lemonade which was really good..
